title: Chinese government donates second batch of anti-epidemic materials to the Equatorial Guinea in June 2020 (linked to Project ID #92785)
description: On June 8, 2020, a ceremony was held for the handover of anti-epidemic materials from the Government of China to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The Chinese Ambassador to Equatorial Guinea, Qi Mei, and José Ntutumu Edu Nchama, the Minister of Health and Social Welfare of Equatorial Guinea, attended the ceremony. The supplies provided by the Chinese Government included testing kits, masks, gloves and protective suits.  This project is the second batch of anti-epidemic materials provided by the Chinese Government to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The first batch of supplies was delivered on April 15, 2020 (see: project ID #92785).

The supplies provided by the Chinese Government included testing kits, masks, gloves and protective suits.  This project is the second batch of anti-epidemic materials provided by the Chinese Government to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The first batch of supplies was delivered on April 15, 2020 (see: project ID #92785).

title: Chinese Government donates anti-epidemic materials to Equatorial Guinea in April 2020 (linked to Project #92784)
description: On April 15, 2020, a ceremony was held for the handover of anti-epidemic materials from the government of China to the government of Equatorial Guinea. The supplies provided by the Chinese Government included N95 masks, general medical masks, medical protective clothing, gloves, shoe covers, goggles and forehead temperature guns.  The materials arrived at the Malabo International Airport in Equatorial Guinea on April 15, 2020. The Chinese Ambassador to Equatorial Guinea, Qi Mei, and José Ntutumu Edu Nchama, the Minister of Health and Social Welfare of Equatorial Guinea, attended the ceremony. A second batch of materials was sent in July, and is captured in Project ID# 92784.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates anti-epidemic materials to Equatorial Guinea in April 2020 (linked to Project #92784)

# Description
On April 15, 2020, a ceremony was held for the handover of anti-epidemic materials from the government of China to the government of Equatorial Guinea. The supplies provided by the Chinese Government included N95 masks, general medical masks, medical protective clothing, gloves, shoe covers, goggles and forehead temperature guns.  The materials arrived at the Malabo International Airport in Equatorial Guinea on April 15, 2020. The Chinese Ambassador to Equatorial Guinea, Qi Mei, and José Ntutumu Edu Nchama, the Minister of Health and Social Welfare of Equatorial Guinea, attended the ceremony. A second batch of materials was sent in July, and is captured in Project ID# 92784.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Anti-epidemic materials including masks, protective equipment, and medical supplies; health sector focus

title: China donates cultural and sports equipment to the China-Equatorial Guinea Friendship School
description: On January 14, 2020, the handover ceremony was held by the Chinese Embassy for the donation of cultural and sports equipment from China to the China-Equatorial Guinea Friendship School. The exact contents and value of this donation is unknown.  Qi Mei, the Chinese Ambassador to Equatorial Guinea, Ricardo Mangue, the Minister of Education of Equatorial Guinea, and the Head of the Equatorial Guinea Friendship School attended the ceremony.

title: Government of China donates 34 SUVs to the Government of Equatorial Guinea in 2020
description: On November 25, 2020, the Government of China donated 34 vehicles to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The donation was made to honor the cooperative relationship among both nations, and was handed over by the Chinese Ambassador, Qi Mei. Among the 34 vehicles, four are buses. The specific monetary value of the donation is unknown, but the vehicles were JMC Yusheng S350's, which is an SUV made by the Chinese company JMC.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Government of China donates 34 SUVs to the Government of Equatorial Guinea in 2020

# Description
On November 25, 2020, the Government of China donated 34 vehicles to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The donation was made to honor the cooperative relationship among both nations, and was handed over by the Chinese Ambassador, Qi Mei. Among the 34 vehicles, four are buses. The specific monetary value of the donation is unknown, but the vehicles were JMC Yusheng S350's, which is an SUV made by the Chinese company JMC.
justification: Vehicle donation is unrelated to energy transition or environmental impact
evidence: Donation of 34 SUVs and buses for general government use

title: China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSEC) donates 6,000 surgical masks to Government of Equatorial Guinea
description: On July 1, 2020, the China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSEC) donated 6,000 surgical masks to the Government of Equatorial Guinea. The donation goes towards combatting the spread of COVID-19 in Equatorial Guinea. The type and value of the masks are unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: China International Development Cooperation Agency provides $1 million grant for Neonatal and Maternal Health Services in Ethiopia
description: Around April 2, 2020, the China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA) provided a $1 million grant to Ethiopia for the purpose of neonatal and maternal health care. UNICEF helped negotiate the grant and will help the Ethiopian Ministry of Health with organizing and distributing the money.   The money is to go to improving newborn intensive care units (ICU), integrated management of newborn and childhood illnesses, community-based newborn care, and clinical mentorship. The project will cover health care in 49 health centers, 219 health posts, and six primary hospitals in Ethiopia, with a focus on underserved regions. The grant will help an estimated 94,000 pregnant women and newborns.  This grant is a part of a larger $8 million USD grant from CIDCA to improve maternal and neonatal services in 8 African countries.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China International Development Cooperation Agency provides $1 million grant for Neonatal and Maternal Health Services in Ethiopia

# Description
Around April 2, 2020, the China International Development Cooperation Agency (CIDCA) provided a $1 million grant to Ethiopia for the purpose of neonatal and maternal health care. UNICEF helped negotiate the grant and will help the Ethiopian Ministry of Health with organizing and distributing the money.   The money is to go to improving newborn intensive care units (ICU), integrated management of newborn and childhood illnesses, community-based newborn care, and clinical mentorship. The project will cover health care in 49 health centers, 219 health posts, and six primary hospitals in Ethiopia, with a focus on underserved regions. The grant will help an estimated 94,000 pregnant women and newborns.  This grant is a part of a larger $8 million USD grant from CIDCA to improve maternal and neonatal services in 8 African countries.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Neonatal and maternal health services, healthcare infrastructure improvement, focus on underserved regions
